sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: A group of Iranian feminists have written to tech giant Meta

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: after their Instagram accounts were targeted by thousands of fake profiles.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Sophia in the Keep has the story.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Yes, Helena, a few weeks ago more than a million bots have flooded the Instagram accounts of multiple prominent feminists in Iran in what looks like a coordinated harassment campaign. Now all of these feminists are connected to the MeToo movement in the country which denounces sexual violence. So over 30 activists have said that they have received thousands of fake followers in just one day as you can see in one of the screen recordings that they shared with us. This cyber attack has prompted a lot of them to make their accounts private. But why would having so many followers be an issue on Instagram you might ask? Well the issue is that if the platform notices that you have collected too many fake followers in a very short span of time it could block your account. But it also has other consequences.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: We spoke to Sara Afrasiabi, one of the feminists that was targeted in the cyber attack.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: I got more than 60,000 fake followers and it's continued.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: They lower my page engagement so my new post wouldn't reach to my real followers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The other issue is that Instagram is the only major social media platform that isn't censored in Iran, which makes it very complicated then for these feminists to, for example, want to migrate their followers to Facebook or Twitter because these platforms are blocked in the country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: This has prompted these women to write this open letter to Meta, which is the parent company of Instagram, calling for a stricter crackdown on these bot campaigns.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00

How they decide to prioritize what country and what problem is clearly political or profit driven. The digital non-profit Curium has published a report where it traced these bots back to at least two Pakistani social media marketing firms.
